words.ENTRY: <H>I</H><audio>I.mp3</audio><PS>pronoun</PS><D>(the subject of a verb) the person who is speaking or writing:</D> <X>I called and said that I was busy.</X><dot><X>I'm taller than you.</X><dot><X>She and I are planning to go out later.</X>
<H>ice cream</H><audio>ice_cream.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>a frozen sweet food that is made from cream:</D> <X>I love chocolate ice cream.</X>

ideanoun1.countablea plan or suggestion: That's a good idea!He has an idea for a new play.2.uncountable, singular
a picture or thought in your mind: uncountableDo you have any idea how much this cost?singularThe program gave a good idea of life in ancient Greece.3.countablean opinion or belief: She has some strange ideas about education.

<H>ideal</H><audio>ideal.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>the best possible; perfect:</D> <X>In an ideal world, there would be no poverty.</X><dot><X>This is the ideal weather for a swim: hot and dry.</X>

ifconjunction1.(used in sentences in which one thing happens or is true, depending on whether another thing happens or is true): If you see him, give him this letter.We won't go to the beach if it rains.If I had more time, I would learn another language.2.(used after verbs such as ask, know, remember): They asked if we wanted to go, too.I can't remember if I mailed the letter or not.3.when; every time: If I try to phone her, she just hangs up.If metal gets hot, it expands.

<H>in</H><audio>in.mp3</audio><PS>preposition</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>(showing place) within the area of something; enclosed by something:</D> <X>a country in Africa</X><dot><X>a town in Mexico</X><dot><X>an island in the Pacific</X><dot><X>in a box</X><dot><X>I read about it in the newspaper.</X><dot><X>She put the keys in her pocket.</X><dot><X>They were working in the garden.</X><dot><X>His wife's in the hospital.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>(showing time) during a period of time:</D> <X>My birthday is in August.</X><dot><X>He was born in 1995.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>(showing time) after a period of time:</D> <X>I'll be finished in ten minutes.</X><NR>4.</NR><D>contained in; forming the whole or part of something:</D> <X>There are 366 days in a leap year.</X>

<H>information</H><audio>information.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><CF>information (on/about somebody/something)</CF> <D>knowledge or facts:</D> <X>For further information, please contact us.</X><dot><X>Can you give me some information about Spanish classes?</X>

<H>instrument</H><audio>instrument.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a tool that is used for doing a particular job or task:</D> <X>surgical instruments</X><NR>2.</NR><D>something that is used for playing music:</D> <X>"What instrument do you play?" "The violin."</X>

intelligentadjectivehaving or showing intelligence, smart:
All their kids are very intelligent.an intelligent question

interestingadjectiveenjoyable and entertaining to do, think about, talk to, etc.; holding your attention: an interesting person/
book/idea/jobIt's always interesting to hear about other cultures.
<H>international</H><audio>international.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>involving two or more countries:</D> <X>an international agreement/flight/competition</X><dot><X>international trade/law</X>

<H>Internet</H><audio>Internet.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>singular</bracket><D>the international system of computers that makes it possible for you to see information from around the world on your computer and to send information to other computers:</D> <X>I read about this on the Internet.</X>

<H>into</H><audio>into.mp3</audio><PS>preposition</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>moving to a position inside or in something:</D> <X>Come into the house.</X><dot><X>I'm going into town.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>in the direction of something:</D> <X>Please speak into the microphone.</X>

<H>invite</H><audio>invite.mp3</audio><PS>verb </PS><CF>invite somebody (to/for something)</CF> <D>to ask somebody to come (to a party, etc.):</D> <X>We invited the whole family to the wedding.</X><dot><X>Shall we invite Louise and Pete to the party on Saturday?</X>

<H>island</H><audio>island.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a piece of land that is surrounded by water:</D> <X>the tropical islands of the Caribbean</X><dot><X>Robinson Crusoe spent many years living on a desert island.</X><dot><X>the bridge to Prince Edward Island</X>

itpronoun1.(used as the subject or object of a verb, or after a preposition) an animal or thing mentioned earlier or that is being observed now: Look at that car. It's going too fast.The kids went up to the dog and patted it on the head.This box is heavy. What's inside it?2.(used for identifying a person): It's your mom on the phone."Who's that?" "It's the mailman."It's me!It's Michael!3.(used in the position of the subject of a verb when you are talking about time, the date, distance, the weather, etc): It's almost 8:00.It's Tuesday today.It's about 50 miles north of New York City.
It was very cold last weekend.It's raining.
<H>its</H><audio>its.mp3</audio><PS>determiner</PS><D>belonging to a thing, animal, etc.:</D> <X>The cat had its dinner.</X><dot><X>The swimming club held its annual meeting last night.</X>
